message.content:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: ByteArrayOutputStream byteArrayOutputStream = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
DataOutputStream dataOutputStream = new DataOutputStream(byteArrayOutputStream);
dataOutputStream.writeInt(123);
dataOutputStream.write(new byte[]{1, 2, 3});
byte[] result = byteArrayOutputStream.toByteArray();
<<<explanation>>>: To use ByteArrayOutputStream and DataOutputStream together, you can create a ByteArrayOutputStream object and pass it as a parameter to the DataOutputStream constructor. Then, you can use the writeInt() and write() methods of the DataOutputStream to write the int and byte array respectively. Finally, you can call the toByteArray() method of the ByteArrayOutputStream to get the resulting byte array.
